meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that enterobiases are common in children.
meanings.sent2: She learned in school that enterobiases can spread easily in families.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in giggles when the teacher mentioned enterobiases.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overrun with pests, resembling a colony of enterobiases.
meanings.sent5: The image of enterobiases crawling in the intestines stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: Enterobiases: the condition of being infected with pinworms
meanings.sent1: Her discomfort signaled a possible case of enterobiases.
meanings.sent2: The nurse confirmed the presence of enterobiases after the test.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined by unexpected guests - enterobiases!
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure gnawed at her like enterobiases in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The documentary vividly portrayed the effects of enterobiases on health.
